meanings.definition: Exhaustion or weakness caused by lack of nourishment.
meanings.sent1: After days of inanition, the starving man could barely stand.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient's inanition as a result of malnutrition.
meanings.sent3: The inanition of the fridge led to a comical search for food in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her inanition for knowledge drove her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent5: The inanition in his eyes revealed the toll of his hunger.

meanings.definition: The condition of being empty or void.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house showed signs of inanition with its dusty rooms.
meanings.sent2: The inanition of the jar made it useless for storing any more cookies.
meanings.sent3: The inanition of the parking lot on a Sunday was eerie.
meanings.sent4: The inanition of the desert stretched endlessly before them.
meanings.sent5: The inanition of the box symbolized the end of an era.
